div.div: We aspire to be a leading, innovative, high-performing school district that graduates each student prepared for college or a career.

a.title: Town Gown Seeks Masks for Community Members

img.alt: Town Gown Seeks Masks for Community Members

div.div: Town Gown Seeks Masks for Community Members
The United Way and the Brockport Fire Department are in need of facial masks. Please help support members of our community who are putting themselves on the front-lines during this pandemic.
VIEW MORE About Town Gown Seeks Masks for Community Members

a.title: BCSD music education program receives award

img.alt: BCSD music education program receives award

div.div: BCSD music education program receives award

The Brockport Central School District (BCSD) has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education. This is the fifth time the district has won the award.
VIEW MORE About BCSD music education program receives award

a.title: BCSD hosts blood drive at Barclay School

img.alt: BCSD hosts blood drive at Barclay School

div.div: BCSD hosts blood drive at Barclay School
Brockport Central School District will hold an American Red Cross blood drive on 4/22 at the Barclay School Café.
VIEW MORE About BCSD hosts blood drive at Barclay School
BCSD is pleased to announce the appointment of Jerrod Roberts as principal at Oliver Middle School.
VIEW MORE About Jerrod Roberts named OMS Principal
Due to the school closures caused by COVID-19, NYSED suspends the 2020 elementary and intermediate-level State assessments.
VIEW MORE About NYSED Statement on State Assessments
Please see the following updates on the Free School Meal Program, Instruction and BCSD building access.
VIEW MORE About Student Meals Program
Brockport Central School District, upon the directive of the Monroe County Health Department, will be closed to students beginning Monday, March 16 until further notice.

div.div: Hill teacher wins RMSC STEM Education Award
BCSD is proud to announce that Blaine Broughton, Hill School STEM Enrichment Specialist, was awarded the RMSC STEM Education Award for PreK-6.

div.h1: Welcome to Brockport Central School District
div.p: Located in New York in the historic Erie Canal village of Brockport, minutes from downtown Rochester, the Brockport Central School District serves 30,000 residents over 72 square miles. Our pre-kindergarten through grade 12 campus includes five schools (three elementary, one middle and one high school) and is right next door to The College at Brockport. The administration building is located at 100 Central School Drive, behind the tennis courts.

div.span:
The Brockport Central School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs, activities, employment, and admissions; and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups.
The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Jerilee DiLalla, Compliance Officer/Coordinator, at: Email - Jerilee.DiLalla@bcs1.org, Telephone - (585) 637-1912, Address – 40 Allen Street, Brockport, NY 14420. Inquiries concerning the application of the Brockport Central School District non-discrimination policies may also be referred to the U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights (OCR), 32 Old Slip, 26th Floor, New York, NY 10005, Telephone (646) 428-3800 (voice) or (800) 877-8339 (TTY).​
